topics.body:
"@ToskiHero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b72ff263687265eaab0300#post_54b72ff263687265eaab0300
[bq="ToskiHero"]"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b72f986368726f2f990800#post_54b72f986368726f2f990800
Yeah, that always seems to be the problem with making powered armor.
Too much weight, not enough power to power the suits, and heat problems.[/bq]
Okay; I'm going to have to stop this argument right here and destroy everyone's dreams yet again.

The problem with power armor is that hypothetically speaking let's say the way it stops bullets is that it's made out of a fabric that exerts a force to counter stabs, cuts and bullets; the immediate problem with that is to use an analogy you know how putting a strong magnet on a computer screen or such permanently bricks it?  Now imagine doing that to a power armor suit that requires specific calibration to counter bullets; any powerful magnet chances are would permenantly brick the entire suit.
